questions.question_text:
You want to distribute a set of structured data to your customers who can integrate this data into their existing databases irrespective of the platform.
Which method provides the fastest way of achieving this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I'm tempted to answer c, but after reading this I would go for d:

What is transportable tablespace in Oracle?
Transportable tablespaces and transportable tables transport data that resides in user-defined tablespaces. Use the transportable tablespaces feature to move a set of tablespaces between databases. Transporting Data Across Platforms. You can transport data across platforms.

Correct

You can use RMAN to transport tablespaces across platforms with different endian formats. You can also use RMAN to transport an entire database to a different platform so long as the two platforms have the same endian format.

https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E18283_01/backup.112/e10642/rcmxplat.htm

questions.question_text:
You create a locally managed tablespace ORDERS_TBS with automatic segment management.
You then create the table DAILY_ORDS_LST in the ORDERS_TBS tablespace using the command.
CREATE TABLE daily_ords_1st(ordno NUMBER, ord_date DATE) PCTFREE 20;
How does the PCTFREE storage parameter influence data storage for this table?

choices.B: It minimizes row chaining during row insertion.
choices.C: It minimizes row migration during existing row data updation.
choices.A: It allows only 80% of space to be occupied in all data blocks of this table.
choices.D: It automatically coalesces free space of a data block when it reaches 20% of available space.

comments.content:
The PCTFREE SQL parameter sets the minimum percentage of a data block reserved as free space for updates to existing rows. PCTFREE is important for preventing row migration and avoiding wasted space.
https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/CNCPT/logical.htm#CNCPT1053

I agree that is C now. PCTFREE will not limited the data block usage below 80%. It will move to next data block when it reach 80% used. I mean you can make the data block usage exceed 80% by update the row, so it is not A. 
However, It reserve 20% for the updated which make a cushion for row migration.

discussion.content:
Answer A: The PCTFREE parameter sets the minimum percentage of a data block to be reserved as free space for possible updates to rows that already exist in that block.
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/B19306_01/server.102/b14220/logical.htm

comments.content: so, the question is 'PCTFREE storage parameter influence'. a is correct
sorry, the answer is c, yosiw96816 is right

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The PCTFREE SQL parameter sets the minimum percentage of a data block reserved as free space for updates to existing rows. PCTFREE is important for preventing row migration and avoiding wasted space.

While the percentage of free space cannot be less than PCTFREE, the amount of free space can be greater. For example, setting PCTFREE to 20% prevents the total amount of free space from dropping to 5% of the block, but allows 50% of the block to be free.
option A is not entirely correct as during DML operations, the free space is used for the transaction, so technically, 80% only full is not always right.
The PCTFREE SQL parameter sets the minimum percentage of a data block reserved as free space for updates to existing rows. PCTFREE is important for preventing row migration and avoiding wasted space.

Selected Answer: C
The PCTFREE storage parameter specifies the percentage of each data block that is to be kept free for future updates that might expand the rows stored in that block. This parameter also can be used to control the number of rows that reside in a block.

A. All administration tasks must be done to a specific pluggable database.False
 B. The pluggable databases increase patching time.False
 C. The pluggable databases reduce administration effort.True
 D. The pluggable databases are patched together.True
 E. Pluggable databases are only used for database consolidation.False

questions.question_text: Which two are true concerning a multitenant container database with three pluggable database? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The pluggable databases increase patching time.
choices.D: The pluggable databases are patched together.
choices.C: The pluggable databases reduce administration effort.
choices.A: All administration tasks must be done to a specific pluggable database.
choices.E: Pluggable databases are only used for database consolidation.

questions.question_text: What must you use to read data from a table in your database and write it to an external table?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The ORACLE_LOADER access driver is the default. It loads data from external tables to internal tables. The data must come from text data files. (The ORACLE_LOADER access driver cannot perform unloads; that is, it cannot move data from an internal table to an external table.)

The ORACLE_DATAPUMP access driver can perform both loads and unloads. The data must come from binary dump files. Loads to internal tables from external tables are done by fetching from the binary dump files. Unloads from internal tables to external tables are done by populating the binary dump files of the external table. The ORACLE_DATAPUMP access driver can write dump files only as part of creating an external table with the SQL CREATE TABLE AS SELECT statement. Once the dump file is created, it can be read any number of times, but it cannot be modified (that is, no DML operations can be performed).

I think it's D
https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/SUTIL/GUID-ACF1D3AA-1D61-4682-AEC5-42C944756E12.htm#SUTIL1357
The ORACLE_DATAPUMP access driver can perform both loads and unloads ... Unloads from internal tables to external tables are done by populating the binary dump files of the external table

choices.A: Use SQL* LOADER conventional path load.
choices.D: Use CREATE TABLE. . ORGANIZATION EXTERNAL command with ORACLE_DATAPUMP access driver.
choices.B: Use SQL* LOADER direct path load.
choices.C: Use CREATE TABLE. . ORGANIZATION EXTERNAL command with ORACLE_LOADER access driver.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
Profiles can be assigned only to users and not to roles or other profiles. Profile assignments do not affect current sessions; instead, they take effect only in subsequent sessions.

AD is for sure right
C for sure false

Profile assignments do not affect current sessions. 

You create a database user with the CREATE USER statement.To create a user, you must have the CREATE USER system privilege. Because it is a powerful privilege, a DBA or security administrator is normally the only user who has the CREATE USER system privilege.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about user account administration? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Only users with the SYSDBA privilege can change the tablespace quota for other users.
choices.E: A user requires only the CREATE SESSION privilege to change his or her own password.
choices.D: A user's quota can be set for any permanent tablespace but not for the default temporary tablespace.
choices.C: A new user account can be created only by SYS or SYSTEM users.
choices.A: A user's current session is not affected when the user's profile is changed.
